M ' ; 1$ / V fhi} ; ai: (TST National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) s-5 & 6, Wzt-10, ERa1 , Tf ferit-110075 G5 & 6, Sector-10_ Dwarka_ Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn Dated: 2.08.2014 PQLICY MATTER: Iechnical (164/2014) (Decision taken on File_No NHAILegal/SAC[2013) Sub: Settlement of Disputes Guidelines for one time settlement have been issued whereby the initial negotiations are carried out by a Committee of 3 CGMs: After the initial negotiations by the 3 CGMs Committee, the matter is placed before an Independent Advisory Committee (ISAC): It has been observed that while finalizing recommendations by the CGMs Committee _ there are certain issues, such aS pending variation/change in scope IEOT and other analogous matters left undecided by the Committee. Keeping such issues unresolved by CGMs Committee, the negotiation may not be meaningful. This also leads to unnecessary delay in approving final settlement by the Executive Committee/Board, Therefore, it is necessary that all issues pertaining to the contract package in question including pending/ disputed variation/ change of scope/EoT etc. may be settled/ resolved by CGMs Committee as part of settlement process: The CGMs Committee shall discuss these issues in their recommendations. 2. All Technical Divisions will provide details of pending variation/ change in scope /EOT and other issues to the dealing CGMs Committee in respect of contract packages which have been referred for settlement: 3 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
